page.title: 17THE OPEN CHAMPIONSHIPS
page.content: ST.Andrews is regarded as the "Home of Golf" and has held the Open Championship 22 times, the first occasion being in 1860. In 1984 St.Andrews was host to the 113th competition which was won by Severiano Ballesteros of Spain. The weather throughout the Championship was magnificent and the arrival at Leuchars of Concorde bringing V.I.P.s direct from New York attracted huge crowds. Even on practice days, there was a record attendance with over 40,000 spectators. This meant that the total prize money could be increased by 10% to Â£451,000. (The 1st prize was Â£55,000.) This decision caused much controversy since many people felt that the money could have been more usefully spent on providing sponsorship for promising young British golfers.
